fields.value: Climate Risk Vulnerability Assessment to inform sub-national decision making in Vietnam, Nicaragua and Uganda

authorAffiliation.value: International Center for Tropical Agriculture - CIAT
International Center for Tropical Agriculture - CIAT
International Center for Tropical Agriculture - CIAT
International Center for Tropical Agriculture - CIAT

datasetContactAffiliation.value: International Center for Tropical Agriculture - CIAT

dsDescriptionValue.value:
This project was undertaken to develop and implement a pan tropical Climate Risk Vulnerability Assessment (CRVA) that can identify through an agricultural lens and at a fine resolution which parts of the country are most vulnerable to climate change. 


The CRVA is adaptable to the specific national context and also flexible to data limitations. Based on the academic literature and the latest crop and climate models we provide a robust and repeatable methodology. We conceptualise vulnerability as the combination of the sensitivity of the major food security crops to climate change, the exposure of the population to natural hazards and the potential for the population to respond (Adaptive Capacity). 

We have applied the CRVA to Vietnam, Nicaragua and Uganda. The data is in shapefile format and includes the 1. Adaptive capacity 2. Sensitivity 3. Exposure and 4. Overall vulnerability at the administrative unit for each of the case study countries.

grantNumberAgency.value: Climate Change and Food Security (CCAFs) program

files.description: Shapefile data for CRVA in Nicaragua. All data has been normalised from 0-1. For information on the sources of the data and also description of the data and classification please see methods section of the publication.
files.label: NI_CRVA.zip

dataFile.description: Shapefile data for CRVA in Nicaragua. All data has been normalised from 0-1. For information on the sources of the data and also description of the data and classification please see methods section of the publication.

files.description: Shapefile data for CRVA in Uganda. All data has been normalised from 0-1. For information on the sources of the data and also description of the data and classification please see methods section of the publication.
files.label: UG_CRVA.zip

dataFile.description: Shapefile data for CRVA in Uganda. All data has been normalised from 0-1. For information on the sources of the data and also description of the data and classification please see methods section of the publication.

files.description:
Shapefile data for CRVA in Vietnam. All data has been normalised from 0-1. For information on the sources of the data and also description of the data and classification please see methods section of the publication. 
 	
The data is dived into the following columns: 
FID: ID
Shape: Shapefile polygon 
Name_2: Province Name
Name_3: District Name
VARNAME_3: District Name (English) 
Cas_R: Presence of Cassava (>=5% of the total harvested area is allocated to cassava)  
Ric_r: Presence of Rice (>=5% of the total harvested area is allocated to rice)  
Mai_r: Presence of Maize (>=5% of the total harvested area is allocated to maize)  
Csh_r: Presence of Cashew (>=5% of the total harvested area is allocated to cashew)  
Cff_R: Presence of Coffee (>=5% of the total harvested area is allocated to coffee)  
l_gini: Poverty rate (Gini coefficient) 
l_hlt: Health Care 
l_nfr: Infrastructure 
l_rgn: Organisational Capacity 
l_edc: Education 
l_men: Adaptive Capacity Index (mean of l_gini,l_hlt,l_nfr,l_rgn,led)
SeaLevelRi: Sea Level Rise impact 
Cyclones: Tropical Cyclones frequency 
Drought: Drought occurrence 
Erosion: Soil Erosion risk
Flood: Flood frequency  
Dist_ID: N/A
Rowid: N/A
SEN_I_RICE: Sensitivity of Rice to climate change (2050, RCP 8.5)
SEN_I_ROBU: Sensitivity of Robusta Coffee to climate change (2050, RCP 8.5)
SEN_I_CASS: Sensitivity of Cassava to climate change (2050, RCP 8.5)
SEN_I_CASH: Sensitivity of Cashew to climate change (2050, RCP 8.5)
Sen_I_mai: Sensitivity of maize to climate change (2050, RCP 8.5)
Exp_maize: Exposure of Maize to selected Natural Hazards
Exp_coffee: Exposure of Coffee to selected Natural Hazards
Exp_cassa: Exposure of Cassava to selected Natural Hazards
Exp_cash: Exposure of Cashew to selected Natural Hazards
Exp_rice: Exposure of Rice to selected Natural Hazards
Vul_rice: Vulnerability of Rice to CC (combination of SEN_I_RICE, Exp_rice, l_men) 
vul_coffee: Vulnerability of Coffee to CC (combination of SEN_I_ROBU, Exp_coffee, l_men) 
vul_cass: Vulnerability of Cassava to CC (combination of SEN_I_CASS, Exp_cassa, l_men)
vul_maize: Vulnerability of Maize to CC (combination of SEN_I_mai, Exp_maize, l_men)
vul_cash: Vulnerability of Cashew to CC (combination of SEN_I_CASH, Exp_cash, l_men)
N_crops: Number of crops that are included in final vulnerability, based on columns (Cas_R-Cff_R) 
M_201: Maize area (Hectares) 
R2014: Rice area (Hectares) 
C_200: Cashew area (Hectares) 
C_2012: Coffee area (Hectares)
cass_2013: Cassava area (Hectares)
Vul_2: Final Vulnerability Index (all crops) 
Vul_class: Final Vulnerability Index (all crops-Classified from 5 Highest – 1 Lowest)
files.label: VN_CRVA.zip

dataFile.description:
Shapefile data for CRVA in Vietnam. All data has been normalised from 0-1. For information on the sources of the data and also description of the data and classification please see methods section of the publication. 
 	
The data is dived into the following columns: 
FID: ID
Shape: Shapefile polygon 
Name_2: Province Name
Name_3: District Name
VARNAME_3: District Name (English) 
Cas_R: Presence of Cassava (>=5% of the total harvested area is allocated to cassava)  
Ric_r: Presence of Rice (>=5% of the total harvested area is allocated to rice)  
Mai_r: Presence of Maize (>=5% of the total harvested area is allocated to maize)  
Csh_r: Presence of Cashew (>=5% of the total harvested area is allocated to cashew)  
Cff_R: Presence of Coffee (>=5% of the total harvested area is allocated to coffee)  
l_gini: Poverty rate (Gini coefficient) 
l_hlt: Health Care 
l_nfr: Infrastructure 
l_rgn: Organisational Capacity 
l_edc: Education 
l_men: Adaptive Capacity Index (mean of l_gini,l_hlt,l_nfr,l_rgn,led)
SeaLevelRi: Sea Level Rise impact 
Cyclones: Tropical Cyclones frequency 
Drought: Drought occurrence 
Erosion: Soil Erosion risk
Flood: Flood frequency  
Dist_ID: N/A
Rowid: N/A
SEN_I_RICE: Sensitivity of Rice to climate change (2050, RCP 8.5)
SEN_I_ROBU: Sensitivity of Robusta Coffee to climate change (2050, RCP 8.5)
SEN_I_CASS: Sensitivity of Cassava to climate change (2050, RCP 8.5)
SEN_I_CASH: Sensitivity of Cashew to climate change (2050, RCP 8.5)
Sen_I_mai: Sensitivity of maize to climate change (2050, RCP 8.5)
Exp_maize: Exposure of Maize to selected Natural Hazards
Exp_coffee: Exposure of Coffee to selected Natural Hazards
Exp_cassa: Exposure of Cassava to selected Natural Hazards
Exp_cash: Exposure of Cashew to selected Natural Hazards
Exp_rice: Exposure of Rice to selected Natural Hazards
Vul_rice: Vulnerability of Rice to CC (combination of SEN_I_RICE, Exp_rice, l_men) 
vul_coffee: Vulnerability of Coffee to CC (combination of SEN_I_ROBU, Exp_coffee, l_men) 
vul_cass: Vulnerability of Cassava to CC (combination of SEN_I_CASS, Exp_cassa, l_men)
vul_maize: Vulnerability of Maize to CC (combination of SEN_I_mai, Exp_maize, l_men)
vul_cash: Vulnerability of Cashew to CC (combination of SEN_I_CASH, Exp_cash, l_men)
N_crops: Number of crops that are included in final vulnerability, based on columns (Cas_R-Cff_R) 
M_201: Maize area (Hectares) 
R2014: Rice area (Hectares) 
C_200: Cashew area (Hectares) 
C_2012: Coffee area (Hectares)
cass_2013: Cassava area (Hectares)
Vul_2: Final Vulnerability Index (all crops) 
Vul_class: Final Vulnerability Index (all crops-Classified from 5 Highest – 1 Lowest)
